title: option to hide files from other anonymous uploaders
body:
great work!

i've gotten a request from someone who would like to see a feature that will allow me to hide files that were anonymously uploaded from other third-parties that browse to the anonymous upload link/folder; or i'd like you to give me more reasons why this doesn't need to be included as a feature.

for example:

  - add a checkbox in the sharing dialog to hide uploaded files from public
  - files uploaded by anonymous users will be immediately hidden, effectively always showing an empty folder.
  - or show the file that the anonymous user uploaded like usual, then hide the file once the session in over.  but in the mean time don't show the file to any other public user, 

  - another implementation could be separate upload links for the same folder that will only show files uploaded using that link.

  - yet another would be the ability to generate upload links that automatically expire x minutes/hours after an upload has completed.  this mean the potential to create several links for any given folder.


now for my reasons why perhaps this would just be extra bloat and should not be a feature:

  - since the link is pretty long and can be expired what's the point?  just expire the link after a day and generate a new one for each need.  just having a permanently open anonymous upload != good sysadmin.

  - if anonymous uploads need to happen by many public entities that need not see the other entities uploads, just make another folder - better seperation and security.

  - best practices dictate ....

  - who needs another check box?


thoughts/comments/insults/suggestions?

thanks!

dave.
